description: From Middle English bloren, variation of bleren, blaren, from Old English *blǣran, *blārian (“to blare, bellow, cry”). More at blare.

verbs.description: blore (third-person singular simple present blores, present participle bloring, simple past and past participle blored)

entries.meaning: (archaic, dialectal) To cry; cry out; weep.
(archaic, dialectal) To bray; bleat like an animal; bellow.

description: Perhaps from blore above, a variant of blare, affected by blow. Compare also Gaelic and Irish blor (“a loud noise”).

entries.meaning: (obsolete) The act of blowing; a roaring wind; a blast.
